categories.title: Profile
categories.formation: Graduated from the Rennes Graduate School of Engineering (ESIR)
categories.description: Computer engineer graduated from ESIR, in Rennes, I am looking for a permanent contract as a Full Stack developer from September 2024. Passionate about web and software development, I am ready to bring my skills and my dynamism to a innovative team.

entities.title: Full Stack Web developer
entities.description: Frontend web application in Angular, API in Node.js with the NestJS framework and database hosted in PostgreSQL.
entities.detail:
This internship at the Rennes-based agency ASI aimed at developing a web application for recruitment management, designed for the recruitment team to centralize and facilitate candidate tracking.
At the end of my internship, the first version of the solution was deployed on the company's server. This solution enables the management of applications, tracking of ongoing recruitment processes, and visualization of statistics to assess process efficiency.
The application simplifies the daily work of recruitment teams, who previously had to use and coordinate multiple tools, leading to time loss in managing and sharing KPIs. Now, all information is centralized and easily exportable, optimizing their efficiency.
This experience deepened my technical skills, particularly in application security and deployment. I also gained awareness of best development practices throughout my internship.
tasks: Displaying recruitment process statistics (Backend in NestJS, Frontend in Angular)
Managing candidates, job offers, and applications (Backend in NestJS, Frontend in Angular)
Authentication and authorization via Microsoft account (OIDC, OAuth 2.0 authorization protocol)
Application deployment (Nginx, Docker, Docker Compose, GitLab CI)

entities.title: Frontend Web developer
entities.description: Front-end web application in React with the Next.js framework. Interaction with the backend developed in .NET.
entities.detail:
This internship at Flyx Cloud aimed to develop the frontend solution of a white-label web application for order management, designed for retail businesses.
At the end of my internship, the proposed product covered the entire flow of an order management system, from displaying the store menu to online payment of the shopping cart.
tasks: Displaying a store's menu by scanning a QR Code (React)
Ordering products for table service (React)
Optional account login to earn points (Email, Apple, Facebook, Google)
Online payment of the shopping cart (Mollie)

entities.title: Full Stack Web developer
entities.description: Frontend web application in Flutter/Dart, API in Node.js with the NestJS framework and database hosted in MongoDB.
entities.project: Web application for managing training schedules
entities.detail:
This internship at Wijin aimed to address an internal company need by developing a web application for managing training schedules.
At the end of my internship, the product successfully fulfilled its mission of providing a deployable application while adhering to the expected workflow and the company's health and safety measures.
tasks: Designing the solution architecture (Flutter, NestJS)
Developing technical features (Flutter, NestJS)
Authentication via a corporate Microsoft account
Conducting biweekly demonstrations

entities.title: Domain-specific language for defining robot behaviour
entities.description: Creation of a domain-specific language to define the behaviour of a robot via the creation of a compiler to interact with the robot and an interpreter to simulate it.
tasks: Modelling and implementing the domain with Ecore
Creating grammar with Langium (TypeScript)
Developing an interpreter for a web simulator
Developing a compiler in Arduino code

entities.title: Client-Server micro-services architecture with the LwM2M communication protocol
entities.description: Industrial project aimed at studying the feasibility of an open source architecture covering the LwM2M protocol and creating a model implementing it in a system with various connected devices.
tasks: Analysis of IoT communication protocols
Study of the integration of the LwM2M protocol into a microservices architecture
Description of an architecture using the technologies studied
Implementation of a demonstrator of an LwM2M architecture in a system with connected devices

entities.title: Distributed game on a Client-Server model
entities.description: Implementation of a distributed game based on a client-server model in Java RMI, allowing multiple players to compete in a real-time gaming environment.
tasks: Game architecture design
Game server implementation in Java RMI (Java, Spring Boot, Spring Remoting RMI)
Game client development in Java RMI (Java, Spring Boot, Spring Remoting RMI)
Management of player interactions

entities.title: Generating captions for food images (Image Captioning)
entities.description: Training of a model on a data set, developed in Python with the TensorFlow and PyTorch machine learning libraries and fine-tuned with a model of pre-trained transformers from the Hugging Face Transformers library.
tasks: Extracting image features using pre-trained models (VGG16)
Pre-processing text and image data: cleaning, tokenisation, structuring training/test sets
Designing an encoder-decoder model in TensorFlow/Keras for caption generation
Performance evaluation
Experimentation with pre-trained Transformer models (Hugging Face)

entities.title: Evaluation of young football players in data engineering
entities.description: Analysis of scouting data for football players in Europe. The aim is to identify future stars in the seven biggest European leagues, focusing on players under the age of 23.
tasks: Retrieving football player data via web scraping (BeautifulSoup and Selenium WebDriver)
Data processing with Pandas and Numpy
Player performance analysis
Data visualisation

entities.title: Peer-to-peer mobile gaming application
entities.description: Peer-to-peer gaming app. This app offers six challenges to be completed alone or with others using Wi-Fi peer-to-peer technology.
tasks: Designing the application architecture (Flutter, Dart)
Developing a connection using Peer-to-Peer WiFi technology (Flutter)
Designing a competition mode for single-player or multiplayer gameplay. Multiplayer mode allows you to play with nearby players using direct WiFi.
Design of a training mode for playing challenges at will
Saving scores
Conducting demonstrations

entities.title: Microservices architecture of an association manager
entities.description: Web application providing access to an administrative management system for associations and enabling emails to be sent to association members.
tasks: Designing the solution architecture
Developing the front-end client (Angular)
Developing an API server (NestJS) that communicates with the database
Developing a notification microservice (Quarkus)
Sending AMQP messages to the RabbitMQ MOM (MessageOriented Middleware) queue
Setting up an Nginx frontend web server

entities.title: Compiler for new programming language While in C++
entities.description: Design and implementation of a compiler for a new programming language, While, with generation of intermediate code in 3 addresses and implementation of an execution library in C++.
tasks: Designing the grammar of the While language
Creating the lexer and parser with ANTLR
Generating intermediate code in 3 addresses
Implementing the runtime library for C++
Unit testing and compiler validation

entities.title: Mobile application for signposting and cleaning up illegal dumping
entities.description: Design of an application that allows users to report and clean up illegal dumpsites in the outskirts of Rennes.
tasks: Development of an Android mobile application (Java, XML)
Use of geolocation to report illegal dumping
Use of the camera to take photos of the dumping sites
Use of the map to view the dumping sites
Hosting of the database on Firebase
Conducting demonstrations

entities.title: Tower Defense
entities.description: Development of a Tower Defence game in Java, where the player must defend a castle against different waves of monsters (land, flying and golems). Three randomly generated boards offer varied routes. The player can place, upgrade and manage different towers (archers, bombs, lasers) to repel successive waves.
tasks: Design and implementation of game logic
Creation of monster and tower classes
Implementation of player controls
Graphics display management

entities.school: ESIR - Rennes Graduate School of Engineering
ESIR - Rennes Graduate School of Engineering
